hanzi-su-wiki:
煙

Значения

Дымиться; табак; курение

Мнемоника

Если огонь 火 присыпать, т.е. заткнуть 西 землёй 土, повалит дым как при курении табака.

Варианты

烟
purpleculture_pinyin:
yān
cigarette or pipe tobacco; Classifiers: 根 ; tobacco plant; (of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
сигаретный или трубочный табак; Классификаторы: 根; табачное растение; (глаз) раздражение дымом

heisig_chinese_memo: In the Old West, they used to light fires in the ground to make smoke signals.
heisig_constituent: smoke, hearth fire, old west, soil, dirt, ground
koohiiStory1: In the Old West, they used to light fires in the ground to make smoke signals.
koohiiStory2: Should be easy. SMOKE brings to mind "Where there´s SMOKE, there´s FIRE". So, the FIRE in the OLD WEST can tell people we´re you´re at, so put out the FIRE with SOIL to keep the SMOKE to a minimum.
jp_example_words:
煙たい(けむたい): smoky, feeling awkward
煙る(けむる): to smoke (e.g. fire)
煙草(たばこ): (pt:) (n) (uk) tobacco (pt: tabaco), cigarettes
煙突(えんとつ): chimney
禁煙(きんえん): No Smoking!
煙い(けむい): smoky
煙(けむり): smoke, fumes
jp_readingExamples: 煙い (けむ.い), 煙る (けむ.る), 煙 (けむり)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You have a fire going on some dirt when a helicopter flies overhead. This causes smoke from the fire and the dirt to spread everywhere! It's in your eyes, your mouth, your ears! The smoke gets in your lungs and you can't breathe. Why helicopter, why!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the smoke stopping up your lungs and getting in your eyes. All you know other than the smoke is the sound of the helicopter that's causing it to happen.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The smoke is too much and you realize this is the end (えん) for you. You're gonna die here!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine choking on the smoke and accepting that this is the end. Boohoo, if only you'd learned more kanji before the end!
Ru_trainchinese:
yān: (сущ/глаг) дым; сигарета, сигара; табак; (о дыме) разъедать
yān: (графема) дымка, пар, туман; сажа; опиум
Kanshudo_mnemonic: on western (覀) ground (土), where there's fire (火) there's smoke
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " fire " and "垔", the original meaning is the mixed gas produced when the substance burns. The words " smoke " and " smoke " were used in ancient times. "Said Wen": "Smoke, fire and gas. From the sound of fire. Smoke, or from the cause. 𡨾, ancient prose. 𤎟, the text from the 宀." "Ji Yun": "Qi is also made 𡇽." "Mandarin ‧ Lu "On the words": "It is buried and burned, and the smoke penetrates above."

" Smoke " can refer to smoke, such as clouds and fog. Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Cao's "Furious Singing" Part 2: "When I came from the northwest, Immortal Dao drove a lot of smoke."

" Smoke " also refers to the ash accumulated by smoking, which can be used to make ink. Mrs. Jin Wei's "Brush Array Picture": "Mo took Lushan pine smoke."

" Smoke " can be further extended to ink. Southern Dynasties Liang Yu Jianwu "Xie Lai's Bronze Inkstone Pen Geqi": "Smoke-grinding bluestone has become the altar of Confucius; if you care about the bronze dragon, you still laugh at Wang Shengzhibi."

" Tobacco " also refers to tobacco products. Qing Yu Zhengxie's "Guisi Cun Manuscript" Volume 11: "Chongzhen Mo, Jiaxing was planted everywhere, and three-chief boys would not eat cigarettes."

" Smoke " can also refer specifically to opium. "Manuscripts of Qing History-Lin Zexu Biography": "Catch the smoker."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " fire " and "垔", the original meaning is the mixed gas produced when the substance burns.
humanum_full_description:
從「火」，「垔」聲，本義為物質燃燒時產生的混合氣狀物。「煙」、「烟」二字古通用。《說文》：「煙，火气也。从火垔聲。烟，或从因。𡨾，古文。𤎟，籒文从宀。」《集韻》：「籀亦作𡇽。」《國語‧魯語上》：「既其葬也，焚，煙徹于上。」

　　「煙」可指煙狀物，如雲、霧等。三國魏曹操〈氣出唱〉之二：「從西北來時，仙道多駕煙。」

　　「煙」還指煙熏所積的灰，可製墨。晉衛夫人《筆陣圖》：「墨取廬山松煙。」

　　「煙」可進一步引申為墨。南朝梁庾肩吾〈謝賚銅硯筆格啟〉：「煙磨青石，已賤孔子之壇；管撫銅龍，還笑王生之璧。」

　　「煙」亦指煙草製品。清俞正燮《癸巳存稿》卷十一：「崇禎末，嘉興遍處栽種，三尺童子莫不食煙。」

　　「煙」還可特指鴉片。《清史稿‧林則徐傳》：「捕拏煙犯。」
humanum_short_description: 從「火」，「垔」聲，本義為物質燃燒時產生的混合氣狀物。

①物質燃燒時所生的氣體：冒煙。硝煙。煙囪。煙霧。煙波。煙火。煙塵。荒無人煙。
②像煙的：煙霞。煙靄。煙嵐。煙鬟。
③煙氣刺激使眼睛流淚或睜不開：煙了眼睛。
④一年生草本植物：菸草。菸葉。
⑤菸草製成品：香菸。捲菸。紙菸。菸蒂。
⑥指“鴉片”：大煙。煙燈。煙槍。煙館。

從「 火 」，「 垔 」聲，本義為物質燃燒時產生的混合氣狀物。「 煙 」、「 烟 」二字古通用。《說文》：「煙，火气也。从火垔聲。烟，或从因。𡨾，古文。𤎟，籒文从宀。」《集韻》：「籀亦作𡇽。」《國語‧魯語上》：「既其葬也，焚，煙徹于上。」 「 煙 」可指煙狀物，如雲、霧等。三國魏曹操〈氣出唱〉之二：「從西北來時，仙道多駕煙。」 「 煙 」還指煙熏所積的灰，可製墨。晉衛夫人《筆陣圖》：「墨取廬山松煙。」 「 煙 」可進一步引申為墨。南朝梁庾肩吾〈謝賚銅硯筆格啟〉：「煙磨青石，已賤孔子之壇；管撫銅龍，還笑王生之璧。」 「 煙 」亦指煙草製品。清俞正燮《癸巳存稿》卷十一：「崇禎末，嘉興遍處栽種，三尺童子莫不食煙。」 「 煙 」還可特指鴉片。《清史稿‧林則徐傳》：「捕拏煙犯。」
From the sound of " fire" and " 垔", the original meaning is the mixed gas produced when the substance burns. The words " smoke" and " smoke" were used in ancient times. "Said Wen": "Smoke, fire and gas. From the sound of fire. Smoke, or from the cause. 𡨾, ancient prose. 𤎟, the text from the 宀." "Ji Yun": "Qi is also made 𡇽." "Mandarin ‧ Lu "On the words": "It is buried and burned, and the smoke penetrates above." " Smoke" can refer to smoke, such as clouds and fog. Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Cao's "Furious Singing" Part 2: "When I came from the northwest, Immortal Dao drove a lot of smoke." " Smoke" also refers to the ash accumulated by smoking, which can be used to make ink. Mrs. Jin Wei's "Brush Array Picture": "Mo took Lushan pine smoke." " Smoke" can be further extended to ink. Southern Dynasties Liang Yu Jianwu "Xie Lai's Bronze Inkstone Pen Geqi": "Smoke-grinding bluestone has become the altar of Confucius; if you care about the bronze dragon, you still laugh at Wang Shengzhibi." " Tobacco" also refers to tobacco products. Qing Yu Zhengxie's "Guisi Cun Manuscript" Volume 11: "Chongzhen Mo, Jiaxing was planted everywhere, and three-chief boys would not eat cigarettes." " Smoke" can also refer specifically to opium. "Manuscripts of Qing History-Lin Zexu Biography": "Catch the smoker."

煙字的基本解释

煙
yān
同“烟”。

煙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yān］
［《廣韻》烏前切，平先，影。］
亦作“烟1”。
(1)物质燃烧时产生的混合气状物，呈黑、白等色。
(2)谓由于烟的刺激使眼睛流泪或睁不开。
(3)指烟状物，如云、雾等。
(4)柔美貌；摇曳貌。参见“煙態”。
(5)烟熏所积的灰，可制墨。
(6)指墨。用于书写、绘画。
(7)烟草。
(8)指烟草制品。有水烟、旱烟、卷烟、雪茄烟、鼻烟等。
(9)特指鸦片。
(10)见“煙煙”。
(11)通“燕2”、“胭”。参见“煙支”。
[②]［yīn］
(1)通“禋”。参见“煙2祀”。
(2)通“堙”。填塞。参见“煙2資”。
(3)见“煙2煴”。

煙字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　煙； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页677第07
〔古文〕???【唐韻】烏前切【集韻】【韻會】因蓮切【正韻】因肩切，?音燕。【說文】火气也。【周禮·秋官·蟈氏】以其煙被之。　又姓。見【字彙】。　又於眞切，音因。【周禮·春官·大宗伯註】禋之言煙也。周人尚臭，煙氣之臭聞者。【註】煙音因。【柳宗元·祭从兄文】留連遊歡，涉月彌旬，夜?膏炬，晝凌風煙。　【說文】或作烟。【集韻】籀亦作?。

Basic explanation of words
smoke
yān
Same as "smoke".
smoke
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yān］
["Guangyun" Wuqianqie, Pingxian, shadow. ]
Also known as "Smoke 1".
(1) The gas mixture produced when the substance burns, showing black, white and other colors.
(2) It is said that the eyes shed tears or cannot be opened due to the stimulation of the smoke.
(3) Refers to smoke, such as clouds, fog, etc.
(4) Soft and beautiful appearance; swaying appearance. See "Smoke State".
(5) The ash accumulated by smoking can be used to make ink.
(6) Refers to ink. Used for writing and painting.
(7) Tobacco.
(8) Refers to tobacco products. There are hookah, dry tobacco, cigarettes, cigars, snuff and so on.
(9) Especially opium.
(10) See "Smoke Smoke".
(11) Through "Yan 2" and "Rouge". See "cigarettes".
[②]［yīn］
(1) Through "hungry". See "Yan 2 Si".
(2) Through "堙". Stuffing. See "Tobacco 2 Capital".
(3) See "Smoke 2 煴".
smoke

[Si Collection] [Fire Word Department] 　烟; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 677 No. 07
〔古文〕???【Tang Yun】Wuqian cut 【Jiyun】【Yunhui】Because of lotus cut 【Zhengyun】Because of shoulder cut,? Yin Yan. [Said the text] Huo. 【Zhou Li·Qiuguan·Kampuchi】It is covered by its smoke.　Another last name. See 【Vocabulary】.　 Yu Yuqie again, because of the sound. 【Zhou Li·Chun Official·Da Zong Bo Note】The greedy words are also smoked. Zhou people are still stinky, and those who smell the smell of smoke. [Note] Because of smoke sound. [Liu Zongyuan·Ji Cong Xiongwen] Lilian Youhuan, covering the moon, anointing the torch at night, and wind and smoke during the day.　【Speaking text】or making cigarettes. [Ji Yun] Xie also made?.

yān
вм. 烟
Radicals: 火, 覀, 土  (fire, helicopter, dirt)
Meaning Mnemonic
You have a fire going on some dirt when a helicopter flies overhead. This causes smoke from the fire and the dirt to spread everywhere! It's in your eyes, your mouth, your ears! The smoke gets in your lungs and you can't breathe. Why helicopter, why!
Imagine the smoke stopping up your lungs and getting in your eyes. All you know other than the smoke is the sound of the helicopter that's causing it to happen.
Reading Mnemonic
The smoke is too much and you realize this is the end (えん) for you. You're gonna die here!
Imagine choking on the smoke and accepting that this is the end. Boohoo, if only you'd learned more kanji before the end!
